Overview.Phrase: Integrating a project type for IronPython.

Introduction.Summary: This sample is a component of IronPython integration inside Visual Studio and it demostrates how to create a project type and a winforms designer. The sample is based on the Project Framework and references the source code installed with the VSSDK. Support is also included for the WPF designer. The main goals of this sample are:
Introduction.Goal: Creating a Visual Studio project type for building Windows Forms applications using Iron Python
Creating a Visual Studio project type for building Web Application Projects using Iron Python
Creating a Visual Studio project type for building Web Site Projects using Iron Python
Creating a Visual Studio project type for building WPF Applications using Iron Python

BuildingTheSample.Step: Press F5 to build the sample, register it in the experimental hive, and launch Visual Studio from the experimental hive.

SampleTask.Step: On the File menu, click New Project to display the New Project dialog box.

Create a new PythonProject Console Application. The new solution appears in Solution Explorer, the file Program.py appears in the code editor, and the project properties appear in the Properties Browser.
Right-click the project node and click Properties.
The Property Pages dialog box appears and displays the common and configuration properties.
Close the dialog box. Press F5 to build and run the IronPython program Program.py. A console window opens, displays "Hello VSIP!", and closes.
